Key Match Events: The Yankees lost to the Cardinals 14-7
The Yankees fell behind 7-2 in the top of the 5th inning but came back to tie the game
The turning point was a five-run 7th inning by the Cardinals
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees were trying to hang onto their lead over Baltimore in the AL East
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed disappointment about the loss and the team's inability to finish the series
Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback but acknowledged the need for improvement
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game featured bad starting pitching by Nestor Cortes, a terrible showing from the bullpen, and some shaky defense, especially by Juan Soto
Others: The Yankees dropped a second straight series to a National League team that’s barely in playoff contention
The misery began with Cortes, who’d allowed just one run over 20 ²/₃ innings in his previous three starts but was knocked around for five runs on nine hits in four innings Sunday
Scott Effross, in his first appearance since 2022 Tommy John surgery, was awful in the 5th inning
The Yankees stormed back against right-hander Miles Mikolas in the bottom of the 5th inning
In the 6th inning, Volpe knocked in a run when Winn misplayed his one-hopper into a hit
The game fell apart for the Yankees in the 7th inning
